metadata.Title: CVE-2023-5732 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An attacker could have created a malicious link using bidirectional characters to spoof the location in the address bar when visited. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 117, Firefox ESR < 115.4, and Thunderbird < 115.4.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5732` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
